children.subject: You can't retake unless you fail a class. Yes, you can use the late change form and it will be as if you had never taken the class

history.content:
I'm really concerned about this plan for the following reasons: 

  • You can still meet the 3.30 with a B in this course
  • A B is a good grade
  • As a jr transfer, you don't have much time to complete your degree requirements. Dropping and repeating this course adds an extra requirement to your schedule
  • You only get to use this petition once. Using it your first semester for a course you're passing means you've painted yourself in a corner if you have a more dire situation in future semesters. 

Please read my other note and schedule an advising appointment with someone :)
Save your late drop for later. There are other classes that are significantly more challenging than 61A and a late drop is nice for those classes.

Hi everyone, 

I'm junior transfer and undeclared CS, I'm taking 61A and B this semester and 70 next semester. Because of stress, 61B projects and sick, I did not get a good score on 61A midterm 2. 99% i will get B for this course (61A). I wonder, could I drop this course by using "L&S Late Change To Schedule" and retake next semester?. would "Withdraw" for 61A will affect to my pre-CS GPA ? 

*Another question: If I keep B for 61A in this semester, will I be allowed to retake 61A in Summer 2019?

I'm also worried about Financial Aid because of withdraw a class which made below 13 units, anyone was in this situation, please share your thought and help me out :"<
history.subject: Use Drop-Emergency for CS 61A
